definition: old variant of 曆|历[li4]/old variant of 歷|历[li4]

sentences.english: The editorial was a trail balloon to test the public's reaction to a change in the school day.
sentences.chinese: 这篇社论是要试探出公众对于变更校历的反应。

sentences.english: But this time, the Ministry of Education has not approved the school calendar included in the school holidays.
sentences.chinese: 但当时的教育部没有批准把这个节日列入学校校历。

sentences.english: Maple Leaf Institute of Technology and other independent programs will have a school calendar other than this.
sentences.chinese: 大学和其他独立项目校历参照执行或另行颁发。

sentences.english: Students at school should go through the procedure during the regulated period of the school calendar of the next semester after obtaining credits.
sentences.chinese: 在校生应于取得学分后次学期校历规定时间内办理。

sentences.english: Semester System – The most common type of academic calendar system at college campuses.
sentences.chinese: 大学中常见的校历形式。

sentences.english: I teach because I like the pace of the academic calendar.
sentences.chinese: 我教书，是因为我喜爱校历的步调。

sentences.english: Well, I teach because I like the pace of the academic calendar.
sentences.chinese: 我教书是因为我喜欢校历的节奏。

sentences.english: First, I want to teach because I like the pace of academic calendar.
sentences.chinese: 首先，我想教书，是因为我喜爱校历的步伐。

definition: foundation of a University or College/school opening/the start of a new term
to have a holiday or vacation
